info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 6:36PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scurry and northeastern Mitchell Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Colorado City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colorado City, Loraine, Colorado City Airport, Inadale, Lake Colorado City, Champion Creek Reservoir, Lake Colorado City State Park, Westbrook and Buford. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 207 and 228. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Texas.
